data.message: Dear Facebook,                                                         I would like to report a problem. You disabled the account of my Daughter, Farah, saying she wasn't legal enough and she's under 13. It wasn't her that changed the account settings, it was her little brother who took her phone by mistake and changed the birthday's settings. I would like from you to give her the account back seeing as her birthday's settings were 25/11/1992 not 2002.

replies.message:
Hi, Rania. Your daughter can submit an appeal using the email address that was connected to their Facebook account: http://bit.ly/2ex5FtO. Note that, because Facebook members 13 and older are considered authorized account holders, we can't give you information about the account or take any action on the account at your request.
Learn more about our policies by reading the Facebook Community Standards: http://bit.ly/2ex39UE. -Rhea
Would she get her Facebook account when she becomes 13 depending on the date that she had inserted?
